description: Daria Tomenko discreetly meets with Harmonists' technicians to assess system failures and discuss stabilization plans.
Daria implements software patches in critical BCI systems, temporarily reducing scoring anomalies and calming public concerns.
With minor improvements noticed, the Council starts considering Harmonists' suggestion to revert to older BCI models for stability.
An unofficial report hints that experimental algorithms from Innovators could further destabilize the BCI, intensifying Council's internal debates.
Harmonists push for quick adoption of their stability-focused reforms within Council sessions, citing slowing system failures as evidence.
The Directorate, wary of potential unrest if Harmonists' methods fail, quietly prepare strategic enforcement plans to maintain order.
Public unease grows after an anonymous leak outlines Council power struggles, with citizens questioning the system's reliability.
